long_desc.thetext: Hmm.. Looks like the implicit lambdas that we create while code generating get the argument names such as arg0, arg1 etc. which collide with the existing name. Will take a look.
For now, the program will be usable again after renaming the arg1 to something else.
Suggestion: should we simply change to s.t. like arg$0, arg$1. That "namespace" shouldn't be used in source code.

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #3) > Suggestion: should we simply change to s.t. like arg$0, arg$1. That > "namespace" shouldn't be used in source code.
Thanks, but both eclipse and Javac accept such a name for a param/arg.

(In reply to Jay Arthanareeswaran from comment #4) > Thanks, but both eclipse and Javac accept such a name for a param/arg.
Just thinking aloud, would it be a problem to use the counter at the front, like 0arg, 1arg etc.?

(In reply to comment #5) > (In reply to Jay Arthanareeswaran from comment #4) > > Thanks, but both eclipse and Javac accept such a name for a param/arg. > > Just thinking aloud, would it be a problem to use the counter at the front, like > 0arg, 1arg etc.? Elsewhere, synthesized arguments have names starting with a space like " receiver_", we could do the same here as well

Thanks Sasi, let's be consistent then.
